# wheels

**Instance Property**

An array of [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsVehicleWheel] objects representing the vehicle’s wheels.

## Declaration

```swift
var wheels: [SCNPhysicsVehicleWheel] { get }
```

## Discussion

You can dynamically change the suspension and traction properties of a wheel connected to the vehicle by using the corresponding [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNPhysicsVehicleWheel] object or by using [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/General/Conceptual/DevPedia-CocoaCore/KeyValueCoding.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40008195-CH25] with a keypath of the form `wheels[index].propertyName`. For example, the following code changes the size of the first wheel attached to the vehicle, simulating a failed tire:

```objc
SCNPhysicsVehicle *vehicle = [SCNPhysicsVehicle vehicleWithChassisBody:car wheels:wheels];
[vehicle setValue:@0.1 forKeyPath:@"wheels[0].radius"];
```

## Working with a Vehicle’s Physical Characteristics

- **chassisBody**: The physics body representing the vehicle’s chassis.
